chapter.title: Configuration
chapter.para: RESTEasy provides various configuration options used to adjust its behaviour. When using plain RESTEasy, these options can be set using servlet context parameters.

The Seam RESTEasy module provides an alternative way of configuration. The entire configuration is optional and it is not necessary to configure anything for an application to run. However, once the application needs to be tuned, the programmatic or XML configuration are easier to deal with compared to setting servlet context parameters.
The following configuration options are supported:

row.entry: JAX-RS resources that will be registered with RESTEasy
JAX-RS resources which are registered by default, (i.e. by automated classpath scanning) but their installation will be prevented
Used to override value of the Accept HTTP header using value from URI suffixes (i.e. .xml).
Used to override value of the Accept-Language HTTP header using value from URI suffixes (i.e. .de).
Exception type to HTTP response bindings. See chapter for details
Enables/disables Bean Validation exception mapper. See for details

sect1.title: XML configuration
sect1.para: An alternative and more interesting way is to use the seam-xml module and configure the application via XML descriptor.

example.title: seam-xml dependency added to the pom.xml file.

sect1.para: For more details about the seam-xml module, consult the seam-xml reference documentation Once the seam-xml module is added, specify the configuration in the seam-beans.xml file, located in the WEB-INF or META-INF folder of the web archive.

example.title: Seam RESTEasy configuration in the seam-beans.xml file.

programlistingco.programlisting:
<beans xmlns:s="urn:java:ee" xmlns:resteasy="urn:java:org.jboss.seam.resteasy.configuration"> <resteasy:SeamResteasyConfiguration registerValidationExceptionMapper="true"> <s:replaces/>
<resteasy:excludedResources> <s:value>com.example.TestResource</s:value> </resteasy:excludedResources>
<resteasy:mediaTypeMappings> <s:entry key="xml" value="application/xml"/> <s:entry key="json" value="application/json"/> </resteasy:mediaTypeMappings>
<resteasy:exceptionMappings> <s:value> <resteasy:ExceptionMapping exceptionType="javax.persistence.NoResultException" statusCode="404"> <resteasy:message>Requested resource does not exist.</resteasy:message> </resteasy:ExceptionMapping> </s:value> </resteasy:exceptionMappings> </resteasy:SeamResteasyConfiguration> </beans>

callout.para: The TestResource is excluded from the deployment (i.e. for the production environment).
